Module hu.unipannon.virt.plot
Package hu.unipannon.virt.plot.frame

Class PlotSpace

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.Group
          • hu.unipannon.virt.plot.frame.PlotSpace
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Component, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
    public class PlotSpace
extends javafx.scene.Group
implements Component
    The Plot Space is the section in the frame surrounded by the axes. The Plot Space contains the legend and the plot type specific graphical items, so it is the only part that differs between i.e. a line plot and a scatter plot. For easier data representation, the Plot Space has its own coordinate system and properties.
    Properties are established based on the MATLAB graph system, so the base point is the bottom left, and the width / height are given. Items inside the Plot Space can bind to the plot space's properties.
    Author:
    Tóth Bálint
    See Also:
    Frame, Component

      • addLine

        public void addLine​(double[] dom,
                    double[] im,
                    javafx.scene.paint.Paint color,
                    double width,
                    StrokeStyle style,
                    Marker.MarkerType markerType)
        Adds a data line to the plot space. Every item needs to be given to the function. The domain and image of the data must be of same length and containing values in the [0;1] interval. The function draws lines between these points.
        Parameters:
        dom - normalized X coordinates of the line's individual data points.
        im - normalized Y coordinates of the line's data points.
        color - color of the lines as JavaFX Paint object.
        width - width of the line in points.
        style - style of the line.
        markerType - type of the markers. (Can be Marker.MarkerType.NONE.)

      • addPatch

        public void addPatch​(double[] dom,
                     double[] lower,
                     double[] upper,
                     javafx.scene.paint.Paint color)
        Adds a "patch", a color-filled 2D shape with a lower line and an upper line. Can be used to display intervals. The domain, lower and upper lines must be of the same length and contain values in the [0;1] interval. Vertical edges of the patch are connected with vertical lines.
        Parameters:
        dom - normalized X coordinates of the domain points of the lower and upper line.
        lower - normalized Y coordinates of the upper line's points.
        upper - normalized Y coordinates of the lower line's points.
        color - color of the patch in JavaFX Paint format. (Can be RGBA for transparency, or multiple images of Nicholas Cage for comedic effect.)

      • getLine

        public void getLine()

      • addBar

        public void addBar​(double[] dom,
                   double[] im,
                   double baselineOffset,
                   javafx.scene.paint.Paint[] color,
                   double width,
                   BarStyle style)
        Wrapper function to add groups of Bar plots to the Plot Space. Domain and Image array must be normalized between the [0;1] interval. The dom array contains the X coordinates of the bars (or groups) and the im array contains the matrix of the different groups' data in row continous form. The first dom's length long data forms the bars of data for the domain points, and values separated by dom's length form a "data group".
        If the image array contains negative values, the baseline offset can be specified to be the largest absolute value in the negative numbers.
        Parameters:
        dom - normalized X coordinates of the data points (or groups).
        im - normalized matrix of Y coordinates of the data points.
        baselineOffset - offset value from the bottom line of the plot space. All bars will be shifted upwards by this value.
        color - array of colors, used to separate items in a data group.
        width - [0;1] normalised width of a bar or group. Bars fill in their available space based on this value. (0: bars are invisible, 1: bars fill in the max aval. space)
        style - style of the bar plot, can be Stacked or Grouped.

      • addHBar

        public void addHBar​(double[] dom,
                    double[] im,
                    double baselineOffset,
                    javafx.scene.paint.Paint[] color,
                    double width,
                    BarStyle style)
        Wrapper function to add groups of Bar plots to the Plot Space. The only difference from the addBar() function, that this one draws horizontal bars from bottom of the Plot Space to the top. Domain and Image array must be normalized between the [0;1] interval. The dom array contains the X coordinates of the bars (or groups) and the im array contains the matrix of the different groups' data in row continous form. The first dom's length long data forms the bars of data for the domain points, and values separated by dom's length form a "data group".
        If the image array contains negative values, the baseline offset can be specified to be the largest absolute value in the negative numbers.
        Parameters:
        dom - normalized X coordinates of the data points (or groups).
        im - normalized matrix of Y coordinates of the data points.
        baselineOffset - offset value from the bottom line of the plot space. All bars will be shifted right by this value.
        color - array of colors, used to separate items in a data group.
        width - [0;1] normalised width of a bar or group. Bars fill in their available space based on this value. (0: bars are invisible, 1: bars fill in the max aval. space)
        style - style of the bar plot, can be Stacked or Grouped.

      • addScatter

        public void addScatter​(double[] dom,
                       double[] im,
                       double[] size,
                       javafx.scene.paint.Paint[] color,
                       Marker.MarkerType markerType)
        Adds a scatter data series to the Plot Space, works like the addLine() function, except this one does not connect the data points with lines. The domain and image of the data must be of same length and containing values in the [0;1] interval. The function draws lines between these points.
        Parameters:
        dom - normalized X coordinates of the series' individual data points.
        im - normalized Y coordinates of the series' data points.
        size - sizes of the different markers representing the data points. If contains 1 element, it will be used for all points.
        color - colors of the markers representing the data points. If contains 1 item, it will be used for all points.
        markerType - type of the markers.

      • addLegend

        public void addLegend​(Legend l,
                      javafx.geometry.HPos alignX,
                      javafx.geometry.VPos alignY)
        Adds a legend object to the Plot Space to the specified location. The legend's alignment position is based on the given position.
        Parameters:
        l - preconfigured label to be added.
        alignX - horizontal position of the legend.
        alignY - vertical position of the legend.
